video.title: SOME PATIENTS NOT ABLE TO AFFORD PRESCRIPTIONS DESPITE ENROLLING IN MEDICARE PART D PROGRAM
video.description: Medicare’s prescription drug program known as Medicare Part D went into effect in 2006.  It was meant to help increase economic access to prescription drugs especially for the poor and chronically ill.  A new study reveals the program is helping many people however some of the most seriously ill still cannot afford the medicine they need.
